title: Stylist to Boston’s ‘most fabulous socialites’ accused of stealing more than $400,000 in Saks refund scheme
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Authorities allege Suhail Kwatra refunded items his clients purchased but never picked up, converting the funds into gift cards he purportedly spent on himself.
Suhail Kwatra at Saks in 2014.
Lane Turner/Boston Globe Staff, File By Abby Patkin December 10, 2025 | 2:49 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: $12M Watch Hill property .2 miles from Taylor Swift’s hits the market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Luxury Homes The property is on the market for the first time in 90 years, and dates back to the 1800s.
The property at 6-8 Chapel Place in Watch Hill, Rhode Island, is for sale for $12,200,000.

title: Boston suburb approves new $660 million high school
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The new Lexington High School is expected to open for the 2029-2030 academic year.
The entrance to the existing Lexington High School in November.
David L Ryan/ Boston Globe The residents of Lexington voted in favor of a new high school project, estimated to cost $660 million, in a debt-exclusion election on Tuesday.

title: Brookline mother in guaranteed income pilot says it’s been ‘a life-changing experience’

bullets: Local News 53 residents in Brookline are receiving $750 per month in cash for a year.

title: Rescuers save stranded dolphins in Wareham
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News A special marine mammal rescue team responded to a marsh in Wareham to help two common dolphins.
Dolphins stranded in Wareham on Dec.

title: Cruise passenger was served 33 drinks before deadly encounter with crew, suit says
author: Claire Fahy, The New York Times
bullets: National News Michael Virgil, 35, became agitated on a Royal Caribbean ship and was restrained by at least five crew members, including some who stood on his back, before he died, the medical examiner said.
The Navigator of the Seas in 2020.
Michael Virgil and his family were aboard this ship when he died in December 2024.

title: Alleged reckless driver dragged officer, kicked another in the chest, DA says
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Prosecutors said the 27-year-old backed into a parked car and refused to exchange information.
A Roslindale woman was charged on Monday for a driving incident in which she allegedly dragged a police officer and kicked another in the chest.

Avagadra Lipson, 27, was charged with reckless operation of a motor vehicle, assault and battery with a dangerous weapon, leaving the scene of a crime with property damage, refusing to identify as a motor vehicle operator, and resisting arrest, according to the Suffolk County District Attorney’s Office.
